items.title: Why I love the Logitech MX Vertical wireless mouse
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Logitech MX Vertical mouse was purchased in March 2022 after using an Anker model for 3.5 years.
- Features include wired/wireless use, long battery life, customizable buttons, and reduced wrist pain.
- Downsides: attracts dust and skin residue, limited color options, no left-handed version available.
- Highly recommended for individuals needing ergonomic solutions for wrist health.

items.title: Dyson’s high-tech hairdryer for professionals will soon be available to everyone
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Dyson’s upgraded Supersonic r hairdryer will be available to consumers starting tomorrow in the US and in April for Europe.
- It will be sold at $569.99, the same price as the original, with new color options: ceramic pink and jasper plum.
- The Supersonic r is 30% smaller and 20% lighter than the original and features a new motor design for better weight distribution and even heat production.

items.title: Apple announces MacBook Air with M4 chip and a price cut
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Apple introduces the new MacBook Air models featuring the M4 processor.
- New sky blue color option added; 13-inch model starts at $999 and 15-inch at $1,199.
- Available for order now with a launch date set for March 12.
- Both models support two external displays and come with a 12-megapixel Center Stage webcam.
- Entry-level features include M4 chip with 10-core CPU, 8-core GPU, 16GB memory, and 256GB storage.
- Price drop noted as significant against increasing tariffs.

items.title: Apple launches new Mac Studios with M4 Max and M3 Ultra chips
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple introduces new Mac Studios featuring M4 Max and M3 Ultra chips, available for preorder at $1,999 and $3,999, respectively.
- M4 Max model claims to be up to 3.5x faster than the original M1 Max with 14-16 core CPU and up to 40 core GPU; starting RAM is 36GB, with a maximum of 128GB.
- M3 Ultra model features 32 cores, with up to 80 core GPU, starting RAM of 96GB, and support for up to 512GB, with storage options up to 16TB.
- Both models include Thunderbolt 5 connections, with varied USB-C support across configurations.
- Models showcase new graphics features including dynamic caching and a second-generation ray-tracing engine.

items.title: I wore a one-horsepower exoskeleton to the world’s biggest tech show
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The author used the **Hypershell Pro X**, a lightweight exoskeleton, at **CES 2025** to navigate the expansive conference.  
- The device operates in **hyper mode**, allowing longer strides with less fatigue and approximately a **30% reduction** in exertion.  
- The exoskeleton has a **5.3-pound weight** and includes a battery that can limit seating options.  
- The **battery life** allows for up to **13.5 miles** of gentle assistance.  
- Other models at CES, such as **Arc'teryx and Skip Robotics’ MO/GO pants**, provide different designs and features but with some downsides in movement flexibility.

items.title: AMD Radeon RX 9070 / 9070 XT review: Nvidia gets some big next-gen competition
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- AMD launches Radeon RX 9070 ($549) and RX 9070 XT ($599), providing strong mid-range competition against Nvidia.
- RX 9070 surpasses Nvidia's RTX 5070 by 17% in 4K performance; RX 9070 XT matches RTX 5070 Ti at $150 less.
- AMD has 16GB of VRAM on both models, advantageous for 4K gaming compared to RTX 5070's 12GB.
- New RDNA 4 architecture offers improvements in rasterization and ray-tracing performance with FSR 4 upscaling technology.
- RX 9070 series boasts lower power consumption than previous generations and rivals Nvidia's offerings, maintaining cooler temperatures.

items.title: This little AI phone has some wild ideas
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Newnal AI is developing a phone that creates a personal AI avatar from user data.
- The phone captures data from multiple sources including social media, medical, and financial records.
- It encrypts the data and stores it across third-party cloud servers.
- The device uses the AI avatar for tasks like shopping and completing online forms.
- Newnal plans to launch the phone globally on May 1, 2025, with a price of $375.

items.title: Hyundai teams up with Yandex spinoff Avride to develop robotaxis
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Hyundai partners with Avride to develop driverless cars for ridehailing.
- Avride to deploy 100 Hyundai Ioniq 5 SUVs retrofitted with autonomous technology this year.
- Ioniq 5 vehicles will be assembled at Hyundai's factory in Georgia and integrated with Avride's tech.
- Vehicles to arrive in Dallas later this year as part of a deal with Uber for exclusive deployment on their app.
- Avride also plans to explore other projects including delivery robots and smart mobility applications.

items.title: The questions ChatGPT shouldn’t answer
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- OpenAI's ChatGPT released an ethics framework that has been criticized for its simplistic approach to complex moral questions.
- The model spec implies a reliance on singular answers, ignoring the nuanced nature of ethical inquiry and decision-making.
- Challenges arise in answering ethical dilemmas such as the trolley problem, highlighting the varied philosophical perspectives that exist.

items.title: Latest Turing Award winners again warn of AI dangers
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Andrew Barto and Richard Sutton received the Turing Award for foundational AI training techniques.
- They expressed concern over profit-driven AI development practices by companies.
- Barto emphasized the importance of safety testing before releasing AI products to consumers.
- Reinforcement learning, the method they developed, is a cornerstone in modern AI advancements.
- A warning from top AI researchers highlighted the need for prioritizing AI safety to prevent potential risks.

items.title: Digg is coming back, thanks to its founder — and Reddit’s
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Kevin Rose, the founder of Digg, is relaunching the platform with a new team, including Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian.
- Digg aims to create a community-first social platform, emphasizing user engagement and AI to assist content moderation.
- The relaunch includes a prototype with a homepage and sub-communities, focusing on building excitement and evolving with user input.

items.title: Volvo’s ES90 is a high-riding electric sedan with 434 miles of range
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
• Volvo announced the ES90 electric sedan featuring a range of 434 miles.
• It includes a dual setup of Nvidia’s Drive AGX Orin computer and an 800-volt architecture for fast charging.
• The sedan is available in three variants, with power outputs ranging from 329 hp to 670 hp.
• The ES90 can gain 186 miles of range in just 10 minutes of charging and can fully charge from 10 to 80 percent in 20 minutes.
• It boasts a zero to 60 mph time of 3.9 seconds for the Performance trim.
• The vehicle is designed to blur the lines between a sedan and SUV, featuring a height of 60.9 inches.
• The ES90 has significant cargo space, advanced infotainment systems from Google, and utilizes Volvo's new Superset tech stack.
• Starting orders for the ES90 are available in Europe; pricing and US availability are yet to be announced.

items.title: Cadillac’s new electric Escalade IQL will be the longest SUV in production
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- The Escalade IQL will be the longest SUV ever produced, surpassing the gas-powered Escalade ESV.
- Overall length of the IQL is 228.5 inches, offering more luggage and legroom for third-row passengers.
- It provides 24.2 cu.ft. of cargo space behind the third row and 75.4 cu.ft. with it folded.
- IQL offers 4 inches of additional legroom and 1 inch of headroom compared to the standard model.
- It features a 205kWh battery with a range of 460 miles, capable of gaining 116 miles in just 10 minutes of fast charging.
- Production starts in mid-2025 at GM’s Factory Zero in Detroit.

items.title: Daredevil: Born Again is a rough reboot with a promising future
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The new series **Daredevil: Born Again** tries to recapture the gritty essence of its Netflix predecessor.
- Features Matt Murdock’s internal struggle between his superhero and civilian lives, especially after a devastating personal loss.
- The show has undergone significant retooling during production, shifting from courtroom drama to a more action-oriented approach.
- Critics note that while it attempts to bridge old narratives, it feels disjointed and struggles to find its identity.
- Original cast members like Foggy Nelson and Karen Page make brief appearances, introducing new characters like Kirsten McDuffie and a new personal therapist.
- The performance of Charlie Cox and Vincent D'Onofrio receive praise, adding depth to their characters’ complex dynamics.
- Despite its flaws, anticipation grows for a potentially stronger second season due to improvements made towards the end of the first season.

items.title: CES 2025: all the news, gadgets, and surprises
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- CES 2025 features significant product reveals and innovations.
- New smart glasses introduce a new era of wearable tech.
- Panasonic showcases advancements in OLED TV technology, achieving up to 4,000 nits brightness.
- Nvidia announces the next-gen RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 GPUs, along with a personal AI supercomputer named Digits.
- Lenovo reveals a rollable laptop priced at $3,500, along with improvements in their handheld gaming devices.
- The Honda Zero lineup includes compelling electric vehicles with new designs and features.
- The Titan Dragon Edition gaming laptop by MSI debuts at the event.

items.title: The best smartwatches for Android
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Android smartwatch market has seen significant growth and variety in recent years.
- Wear OS 5 has been introduced for devices like Samsung’s Galaxy Watches and Google’s Pixel Watch 3.
- Key considerations when choosing an Android smartwatch include processor capability, ecosystem compatibility, battery life, and charging speed.
- Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic is highly recommended for Samsung users, featuring improved battery life and a sleek design.
- The Galaxy Watch Ultra is ideal for outdoor enthusiasts, boasting superior battery life and durability features.
- For non-Samsung users, the Google Pixel Watch 3 offers a refined experience with better integration with Google services and health tracking features.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts available on Apple’s AirPods lineup, including AirPods Max and AirPods 4.
- AirPods 4 priced at $117 and $169 (with ANC).
- Latest AirPods Pro with USB-C priced at $199 with improved features.
- AirPods Max available for $500 with USB-C support and new features.
- Various retailers offering discounts on multiple AirPods models.
- Significant upgrades in sound quality, comfort, and features for the new models.
- Discounts are already seen shortly after their release.

items.title: CFPB lets banks off the hook and drops Zelle lawsuit
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) dismissed a lawsuit against Early Warning Services and three banks regarding Zelle.
- The lawsuit claimed that these organizations failed to protect users from fraud, leading to a loss of $870 million since Zelle launched in 2017.
- The dismissal means the CFPB cannot bring these claims again, eliminating chances for consumer relief funds.
- Statements from Zelle and the banks expressed approval of the ruling.

items.title: Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 5070 Founders Edition cards won’t launch until later this month
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 5070 Founders Edition to launch later in March.
- Competing models from companies like Asus and MSI available from March 5th.
- Initial launch date was February 28th, but already delayed.
- Founders Edition is expected to be priced at $549.

items.title: Best Buy and Target CEOs say prices are about to go up because of tariffs
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Target and Best Buy warn of imminent price increases due to tariffs imposed by Trump on Mexico, Canada, and China.
- Target CEO Brian Cornell anticipates price hikes in the upcoming days, particularly affecting fruits and vegetables sourced from Mexico.
- Best Buy CEO Corie Barry expects vendors to pass on tariff costs to retailers resulting in higher prices for consumers in America.

items.title: YouTube warns creators an AI-generated video of its CEO is being used for phishing scams
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- YouTube alerts creators of a phishing scam using an AI-generated video of CEO Neal Mohan.
- The fake video claims changes in monetization policy to steal user credentials.
- YouTube emphasizes it will never share information through private videos.
- Users reported similar scams on Reddit, indicating phishing attempts mimicking YouTube.
- Phishing emails often come from deceptive sources, such as "no-reply@youtube.com."

items.title: The crypto industry got what it paid for
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- President Trump announced plans for a U.S. Crypto Reserve on Truth Social, aiming to support the crypto industry.
- The proposed stockpile includes cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Ripple's XRP, raising concerns about how it would be managed.
- Critics argue it undermines the U.S. dollar, with potential negative impacts on fiscal policy, inflation, and international standing.
- A crypto stockpile is seen as benefitting Trump's crypto donors while risking taxpayer investment in volatile assets.
- The future of crypto is uncertain, with significant involvement from hackers and speculation on its viability as a currency.

items.title: MWC 2025: all the phones, gadgets, and commentary from Barcelona
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Xiaomi and Realme showcased concept phones bridging smartphones and DSLRs at MWC 2025.
- Samsung unveiled innovative folding display concepts, including a briefcase screen and foldable gaming handheld.
- Nothing announced the 3A and 3A Pro phones featuring AI capabilities to organize user data and upgraded camera systems.
- Deutsche Telekom revealed plans for an AI Phone that integrates Perplexity Assistant for various tasks.
- Nubia introduced a phone with a rotating camera dial for zoom control, enhancing user interaction.

items.title: The best stuff we’ve seen at MWC so far
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Mobile World Congress 2025 is taking place in Barcelona, unveiling new devices including laptops, smartphones, and accessories.
- Samsung presented multiple innovative prototypes, including a handheld console that folds for portability.
- Lenovo's ThinkBook Flip features a flexible OLED screen, offering multiple display configurations without a motorized mechanism.
- Xiaomi announced the launch of the Xiaomi 15 Ultra in Europe, praised for its camera system with low-light performance.
- Nubia Focus 2 Ultra smartphone introduces a physical camera dial for ease of use.
- Lenovo's Yoga Solar PC concept integrates solar cells, generating power from sunlight to extend battery life.
- Infinix showcased a smartphone with an integrated solar panel for charging.
- HMD's Amped Buds feature a power case that offers wireless charging for other devices.

items.title: Here’s where you can preorder the new entry-level iPad and M3 iPad Air
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
* Apple announced two new iPad models: the entry-level iPad starting at $349 and the iPad Air starting at $599.
* Both models can be preordered starting March 4th; they will officially launch on March 12th.
* The 11th-gen iPad has increased base storage (128GB) and runs on the A16 chip, while the iPad Air features Apple's M3 chip, claiming to be twice as fast as its predecessor.
* Accessories for both models include support for the Apple Pencil USB-C and optional new Magic Keyboard.
* Preorder options available from [Apple](https://www.apple.com/shop/buy-ipad/ipad), [Best Buy](https://www.bestbuy.com), and [B&H Photo](https://www.bhphotovideo.com).

items.title: Trump's First 100 Days: Impacts on the Tech Industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick plans to make an internet infrastructure program ‘technology-neutral’ to benefit Starlink.
- TSMC announces a $100 billion investment to expand chip manufacturing in the US, including new facilities in Arizona.
- CFPB facing legal challenges regarding staff actions under the Trump administration.
- The FTC terminated probationary staff, reportedly influenced by government efficiency measures.
- NOAA faces massive staff reductions, impacting weather forecasting and climate research.
- Trump proposes a Crypto Strategic Reserve including Bitcoin and Ether.
- FAA staff directed to find funding for a Starlink deal to upgrade air traffic control communications.

items.title: YouTube will soon restrict creators from mentioning certain online gambling sites
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- YouTube is tightening its policies on gambling content, effective March 19th.
- Creators will be prohibited from mentioning unapproved gambling services, displaying their logos, or linking to them in videos.
- Age restrictions will apply, disallowing viewers under 18 from accessing gambling-related videos, excluding online sports betting and in-person gambling.
- Content promising guaranteed returns may be removed, impacting creators focused on casino games and applications.
- This move follows previous actions like the ban on gambling ads for masthead ad slots and Twitch's restrictions on certain gambling streams.

items.title: Monster Hunter Wilds is breaking Capcom’s sales records
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - Monster Hunter Wilds sold 8 million copies within its first four days. - It is now Capcom's fastest selling title ever. - The franchise's previous best seller was Monster Hunter World with 21 million copies sold to date. - Capcom is experiencing success amidst a broader industry financial crisis, focusing on developing new games and reviving older franchises. - The popularity of Monster Hunter Wilds has led to cheese naan selling out in Japan due to its in-game popularity.

items.title: Apple reportedly challenges the UK’s secretive encryption crackdown
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple is appealing the UK’s ‘backdoor’ order to access encrypted iCloud files.
- The appeal is filed with the Investigatory Powers Tribunal, which will assess the legality of the order.
- The tribunal may hear the case as soon as this month.
- The UK government issued this order in January under the Investigatory Powers Act of 2016.
- Apple discontinued its Advanced Data Protection service in the UK following the order, which could impact users worldwide.

items.title: Nintendo announces a new Switch OLED bundle ahead of the Switch 2
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nintendo is launching a new bundle that includes a Switch OLED system, a digital copy of Super Mario Bros. Wonder, and a 3-month Nintendo Switch Online membership for $349.99.
- The bundle is released on March 10th as part of "MAR10 Day" celebrations, with discounts on Mario games at retailers like Best Buy and GameStop.
- This announcement comes as the Switch approaches outselling the Nintendo DS, with a planned Nintendo Direct on April 2nd to discuss the upcoming Switch 2.

items.title: Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4 remake launches in July
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Remakes of *Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3* and *4* officially announced, titled *Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4*.
- Launch date set for July 11 on Xbox, PlayStation, PC, and Switch, available on Game Pass Ultimate and Game Pass PC.
- Includes original content and modern updates: new parks, current skaters, and a soundtrack featuring classic songs and new tracks.
- Developed by Iron Galaxy Studios, continuing the work with previous remakes by Vicarious Visions.
- Support for cross-platform online multiplayer for up to eight skaters.

items.title: Sony's new beta program lets you test PS5 updates early
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Sony has launched a new Beta Program at PlayStation for early access to tests for PS5 and PC games, features, and apps.
- Gamers need to sign up only once to express interest in future betas, unlike previous programs requiring multiple signups.
- The sign-up page is currently unavailable, with a suggestion to check back later for access.

items.title: AI now ‘analyzes’ LA Times articles for bias
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- LA Times owner Patrick Soon-Shiong announced the use of AI to label articles with a “Voices” designation for those taking stances or personal perspectives.
- AI-generated “Insights” will be added to articles, providing different views on topics to enhance reader navigation of issues.
- The move faced criticism from LA Times union members who feel unvetted AI analysis may harm trust in media.
- Some AI-generated insights have raised concerns over accuracy and presentation, highlighting a need for editorial oversight.
- Other news outlets also employ AI for various functions, but typically not for editorial opinions.

items.title: Google Messages is using AI to detect scam texts
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google Messages introduces an AI-powered scam detection tool for Android users.
- This tool monitors SMS, MMS, and RCS messages in real-time for suspicious patterns and alerts users to potential scams.
- The feature launches in English, starting in the US, UK, and Canada, with future expansion planned.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- AI technologies are rapidly evolving, leading to significant changes in the internet landscape.
- Companies like Google and OpenAI are competing to enhance their AI offerings and applications.
- The rise of AI chatbots like ChatGPT and technologies such as Gemini are reshaping how users interact online.

items.title: Microsoft’s new Copilot app for Windows has an improved UI
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has rolled out a native version of its Copilot Windows app after it was previously a basic web app.
- The new app features native XAML, a side panel, and an improved user interface.
- It matches the design of the recently launched Copilot app for macOS, supporting features like image upload, voice interaction, and conversation history access.
- The update is available to Windows Insiders via the Microsoft Store and will roll out to all Windows 11 PCs in the coming weeks.

items.title: Donald Trump wants to delete ‘climate’ from federal websites — here’s how you can track the changes
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is actively removing climate change information from federal websites.
- An online tool, the [Federal Environmental Web Tracker](https://envirodatagov.org/federal-environmental-web-tracker-about-page/), has been developed to track these changes.
- The tracker contains over 200 entries of altered federal webpages and will be updated weekly by the Environmental Data & Governance Initiative (EDGI).
- Changes include subtle modifications to webpage titles and complete removal of content related to climate impact on vulnerable communities.
- Advocacy groups are taking legal action to restore removed resources, with some successes from previous lawsuits.

items.title: The team behind Shredder's Revenge and Streets of Rage 4 is making a fantasy beat 'em up
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Dotemu announces a new game called **Absolum**, a fantasy beat 'em up with roguelike elements, developed alongside Guard Crush Games and Supamonk.
- The game will launch later this year on **Switch, PlayStation**, and **PC**.
- Features solo and co-op gameplay with four playable characters, branching pathways, a deep variety of bosses, and an engaging narrative set in the fantasy realm of **Talamh**.

items.title: Split Fiction doesn’t need to be original when the co-op play is this good
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- **Game Overview:** *Split Fiction* is a new co-op adventure game by Hazelight Studios, featuring gameplay that combines sci-fi and fantasy elements with a critique of generative AI.
- **Characters and Storyline:** Players take on the roles of Zoe and Mio, trapped in a machine at Rader Corporation, seeking to escape while navigating virtual simulations related to their stories.
- **Gameplay Mechanics:** The game requires cooperative gameplay with distinct powers for each character that must be used collaboratively to progress through levels.
- **Memorable Moments:** Highlights include a unique two-player pinball sequence where player communication is key, and references to other games throughout.
- **Co-op Experience:** The strict cooperation needed makes it satisfying for players of varying skill levels.
- **Release Date:** *Split Fiction* launches on March 6th on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC.

items.title: What if your phone’s camera was much, much bigger?
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Xiaomi and Realme showcased concept phones at MWC 2025 that merge smartphones with DSLR-like cameras.
- Realme’s concept features an interchangeable lens mount that allows users to attach standard DSLR lenses, although it has balance and ergonomics issues.
- Xiaomi’s Modular Optical System uses magnets to attach a lens with a separate sensor, enabling better photos with a 35mm f/1.4 lens and a 100-megapixel sensor.
- The magnetic connection allows for autofocus with a 10Gbps data transfer, while still including manual adjustments for focus.
- Both concepts aim to offer enhanced photo capabilities, competing with the increasing quality of smartphone cameras.

items.title: Donald Trump’s tariffs, explained
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- US residents are part of what’s been called the "dumbest trade war in history" due to tariffs imposed by Trump on imports from China, Canada, and Mexico.
- A 10% tax on Chinese goods took effect in February, with an additional 10% added recently; a 25% tax on Canadian and Mexican goods began on March 4th.
- Tariffs, defined as taxes on imported goods, are mainly paid by the importers but are likely to be passed on to consumers.
- Economists assert that tariffs ultimately burden consumers and have noted that previous tariffs led to increased prices for goods like washing machines.
- Trump's approach to tariffs, including questioning their legality under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, has drawn criticism from experts.
- There is skepticism about whether tariffs truly lead to job creation in the US, with evidence suggesting that costs associated with tariffs often outweigh job gains.

items.title: Pokémon with guns? All the latest on viral gaming hit Palworld
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nintendo and Pokémon have filed a lawsuit against Palworld developer Pocketpair, citing patent infringement.
- The lawsuit references three specific patents related to gameplay mechanics similar to Pokémon.
- Pocketpair has achieved significant success with Palworld, selling over 15 million copies in its first month of release.
- A major update for Palworld is expected in December, introducing the game's largest and most challenging island to date.
- Amid the lawsuit, Pocketpair is pursuing a mobile version of Palworld, partnering with PUBG developer Krafton for the adaptation.

items.title: CFPB staff and leaders clash about whether they’re allowed to work
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- CFPB leaders and staff are in a legal battle over the agency's future and employee duties amidst claims of attempts to shut it down.
- A lawsuit by the National Treasury Employees Union aims to stop the Trump administration's alleged efforts to reduce staffing, with key testimony expected from COO Adam Martinez.
- Judge Amy Berman Jackson expressed concerns about the agency's directives potentially leading to its closure before the court decision, prompting discussions on a preliminary injunction against terminations.

items.title: A new version of Monopoly replaces cash and math with a mobile app
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Hasbro announced a new version of Monopoly called Monopoly App Banking, replacing cash and the banker with a mobile app.
- The app manages all transactions, making the game faster and reducing cheating; expected availability is August 2025 at $24.99.
- Traditional properties have been replaced with kid-friendly options such as a rocket launch pad and moon, integrating features to appeal to younger players.

items.title: This Google change is breaking some digital photo frames
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Google is changing access to Google Photos libraries, impacting digital photo frames like Aura and Cozyla.
- Aura will disable its Google Photos auto-sync feature on March 17th, 2025, requiring manual photo addition instead.
- New API changes limit app access to photos, removing previous seamless integration.
- Cozyla is also stopping its Google Photos auto-sync feature according to user communications.
- Google's new slideshow features for Google Photos will not replace the removed auto-sync functionality.

items.title: Apple launched a new base iPad
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple announced the 11th-generation base iPad for the first time in more than two years.
- The new iPad features an upgraded A16 chip and double the storage at 128GB, starting at $349.
- Availability begins on March 12th with color options including blue, pink, yellow, and silver.
- The new iPad follows a series of Apple announcements aimed at upgrading their product lineup.
- The previous base model, the 10th-generation iPad, was priced higher at $449, creating confusion in the lineup.

items.title: Apple launches a new M3-powered iPad Air
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple announced the new iPad Air, featuring an upgraded M3 chip.
- The M3 chip is reportedly twice as fast as the previous M1 model.
- Available in 11- and 13-inch models, starting at $599 and $799 respectively.
- New Magic Keyboard attachment adds function keys and larger trackpad.
- Tim Cook teased the announcement with a graphic on social media.
- Apple aims to leverage recent momentum in the tablet market following success with last year's iPad models.
- The update raises questions about the iPad's purpose and whether the upgrades significantly improve user experience.

items.title: Alienware has a $549 QD-OLED gaming monitor
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Alienware announces a new QD-OLED gaming monitor, the AW2725D, priced at $549.
- The monitor features a 27-inch screen with a resolution of 2560 x 1440 QHD, offering excellent blacks and vibrant colors.
- It has a refresh rate of 280Hz, 99% DCI-P3 color coverage, and Delta E<2 color accuracy.
- The AW2725D is cheaper than the current $899 4K alternative, though it has a lower pixel density and potentially other compromises.
- Alienware introduces a curved 34-inch ultrawide model (AW3425DW) for $799, featuring a 240Hz refresh rate and HDMI 2.1 support.
- Dell continues to offer a three-year burn-in warranty on its QD-OLED monitors, ensuring customer protection.

items.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 review: definitely not a $549 RTX 4090
How to mirror your Samsung phone on Windows
